text:
⚠️ Planned update at 2:30 p.m. PT

This is our biggest single-day jump in new users that we've experienced — up 2x from yesterday.

To handle this demand, we need to perform an upgrade to our database. There might be ~5 minutes of downtime as a result.

We're so excited to have you all join our beta!

.... And we're back!

Our database upgrade is now complete. Thanks for your patience!

📢 We just upgraded all outstanding invite codes to be more secure.

Your existing invite codes now reflect this change.
Users receive one invite code for every two weeks they have been on Bluesky. Our in-app text has been updated to reflect this.

You needed blocks. We cleared our calendars to finish building out blocks.

Blocking has shipped to Bluesky web app users and will be available in mobile shortly (version 1.25, when it passes App/Play Store review — hopefully tomorrow morning).

You can access this feature now at staging.bsky.app.

Blocks may or may not work on third-party clients in the short term. Some amount of blocking functionality will work, but because this is a protocol-level change, it will require coordination to get it working across the ecosystem.

Important: Similar to your likes, your block list is public data! 

While users of the Bluesky app can’t easily find this list now, the data is public and enumerable at the protocol level. This means that third-party apps or clients can surface and display your list.

Blocks are just one piece of the approach for composable, community-driven moderation. In the coming days, we'll share more moderation plans as we prepare to launch a federation sandbox. 

Learn more: https://blueskyweb.xyz/blog/4-13-2023-moderation

external.title: Composable Moderation
external.description: A customizable, composable approach to moderation that prioritizes safety and gives users and developers more control.

text:
👋 We're changing up the What's Hot feed! 

We've decided to not show some types of content in the feed (e.g. sexually explicit images). This content is allowed on the app, but since What's Hot has become the landing point for all of our new users, we're updating this simple placeholder algorithm.

The What's Hot feed is just one example of what's possible with custom algorithms — soon, you'll be able to choose the algorithms that power your own feeds.

https://blueskyweb.xyz/blog/3-30-2023-algorithmic-choice

Sandbox mode means that people can start experimenting with federation in a test environment.

We'll provide instructions for how to run your own server in the near future.

external.title: Private Beta Update & Roadmap
external.description: Our priorities continue to be a focus on moderation and curation to ensure a safe and pleasant environment for users, and protocol work to launch federation.

text:
Since our last update, we've shipped new features including:

• custom feeds
• blocks and mutelists
• more fine-grained content moderation controls
• custom domains as handles
• production desktop app
• invite codes per account
• accessibility improvements
• app passwords

Our @atproto.com ecosystem continues to grow:

• open-sourced client https://github.com/bluesky-social/social-app
• feed generator starter kit https://github.com/bluesky-social/feed-generator
• community documentation https://atproto.com/community

To see some projects from our community developers, visit here: https://atproto.com/community/projects

Some highlights include:
• @flipboard.com added Bluesky integration
• @skyfeed.app surfaced custom feeds even before we released them in the official Bluesky app

We staffed a content moderation team with shifts that cover a 24/7 schedule, and consulted with trust and safety experts to establish new processes and policies to support a growing userbase.

We also send out daily invites to the waitlist.

In the near future, you can expect these features & improvements as we move towards federation:

• improved labeling, reporting, and related moderation tooling
• account portability between servers
• updated community guidelines for the app
• protocol documentation and specifications

Now that we've crossed 100k users, we have new preferred methods of feedback — tagging devs does not scale.

Please use:
• In-app reporting feature. Our mods review every report we receive.
• In-app feedback form
• Developers can file an issue on GitHub
• Email support@bsky.app for support requests

Read the full private beta update and roadmap here:

https://blueskyweb.xyz/blog/6-02-2023-beta-update

text:
So... what's Bluesky anyways? We just published an explainer:

https://blueskyweb.xyz/blog/6-13-2023-what-is-bluesky

We're building social where:
• users own their data
• developers will never get locked out of the ecosystems they help build
• creators own their relationships with their audience

external.title: What is Bluesky?
external.description: On Bluesky, users own their data, developers will never get locked out of the ecosystems they help build, and creators own their relationships with their audience.

text:
👋 Heads up — we're releasing a "developer sandbox" for devs to test out the technical bits of federation, like running their own server!

This is a big part of Bluesky's vision of an open ecosystem, but for now, none of this will affect your experience here.

Let's explain what this all means:

Once we feel satisfied with both the technical bits and the safety tooling in a federated service, only then will we release federation.

This is one step towards turning Bluesky into an open network with services run by many different communities.

The "developer sandbox" is a testing area that devs can use to set up their own servers, and also a way for our team to test the technical infrastructure for federation too.

The sandbox network is entirely separate from the server and app that you're using now, so your experience here won't change.

Again, today's release is only a testing environment, and we'll continue to share more info about federation so you'll know what's coming.

Later this week, we'll also share some of our detailed proposals on moderation tooling.

We believe that a public commons is important for social media. These proposals for moderation and safety tooling have been in the works for a while, and we’re excited to share them for community discussion and feedback with you now.

https://blueskyweb.xyz/blog/6-23-2023-moderation-proposals

external.title: Moderation in a Public Commons
external.description: In this post, we share why we believe a public commons is important for social media, as well as some proposals for moderation and safety tooling.

text: Bluesky’s goal is to turn social media into a shared public commons. We don’t want to own people’s social graphs or communities. We want to be a tool that helps communities own and govern themselves.

Social media has a reputation for being emotionally chaotic.

If we’re going to succeed in creating social media as a sustainable public commons, then our moderation and safety tools need to not just be good in theory, but actually help create a better social space than what has come before.

The blog post has links to our proposals on:

• User Lists, Reply-Gating, and Thread Moderation
• Labeling and Moderation Controls
• Hashtags

https://github.com/bluesky-social/proposals

We’re seeking discussion and feedback to develop a rough consensus around these approaches — these tools won’t be effective unless people actually use them.

You can contribute to the discussion on GitHub, or let us know your thoughts in this thread.

Posts now include a “Language” control. This update should fix a common problem with poor language detection filtering posts out of feeds.

This can be set to multiple languages, and it defaults to your device’s chosen language(s). It will remember the last choice you made.

The Android version is still in review, but will arrive soon. We wanted to get this update out as quickly as possible.
https://bsky.app/profile/bsky.app/post/3jzavqt55aa2n

We’ve sent mixed messages over the past week about our policies and processes when a Bluesky user is in a mental health crisis, and want to clarify how we handle these situations.

Content Warning: self-harm. Expand thread to continue reading.

Our general approach is to support people in a mental health crisis to continue interacting and communicating using the app, in the hope that they can receive support and resources from peers in the network. This includes posts containing suicidal ideation.
We apply content warnings to content which would be disturbing or triggering to others, and may reach out to the user privately with additional resources.

There are limits to this approach, and our moderation team has leeway in decision making. For example, graphic images, repeated distinct crises despite attempted support, or coercive pressuring of other parties can result in temporary account suspensions or other interventions.

We aim to be consistent in our decisions, but each situation is unique and nuanced. We have handled several serious incidents to date. We review them periodically in consultation with external subject experts, and expect to refine our policies and interventions over time.

We're publishing an update to our Terms of Service and Community Guidelines.

Our goal was to incorporate feedback we've received from the community to make both these documents clearer, more detailed, and easier to understand.

The new versions will go into effect in full on July 14, 2023.

Bluesky is a public benefit corp with the mission “to develop and drive large-scale adoption of technologies for open and decentralized public conversation.”

The PBC status allows us to pursue our mission above profit, but we still need to make this open ecosystem sustainable.

We raised an $8M seed round led by Neo, with participation from other seasoned allies who want to help us realize our vision of an open commons for public conversation.

With this funding, we can expand our team, manage increasing ops & infra costs, and grow the AT Protocol ecosystem & Bluesky app.

external.title: Our Plan for a Sustainably Open Social Network
external.description: We've been exploring avenues of monetization other than traditional advertising, and have raised a seed round to support our mission and growth.

text:
We’re excited to share our first paid service!

We’re partnering with Namecheap to provide easy custom domain management. With this, you can easily set a custom domain as your Bluesky handle and much more.

Simply navigate to https://account.bsky.app to get started.

external.title: Purchase and Manage Domains Directly Through Bluesky
external.description: We’re excited to announce a new feature that allows users to seamlessly purchase and manage domains directly through Bluesky.

text:
Just as we’ve made our source code public, we also want to be  transparent about our business plans.

We'll experiment with different strategies and services to see what provides real value to our users, and will continue to share what we learn as we build a sustainable social network.

📢 1.39 is now available with a new "Send feedback" tool that's easier to use and includes the ability to attach screenshots.

This release also adds a "Help" link and a couple of small bugfixes and updates.

📢 Version 1.40 is rolling out out now.

• Tapping a user's avatar now opens a preview of their profile (Mobile only)
• Reworked the image warning tool to take less space
• Improved the post language selector
• Fixes to android gestures and text cutoff
User handles that are slur words are a form of harassment. We've deployed a change so that these handles can no longer be created in the app.

Our updated Terms of Service and Community Guidelines go into effect today. We’ll continue to improve these policies and the processes for their enforcement as we grow.

Terms of Service: https://blueskyweb.xyz/support/tos

Community Guidelines: https://blueskyweb.xyz/support/community-guidelines

Our community guidelines include the following:

1. Don’t use Bluesky Social to break the law or cause harm to others.
2. Treat others with respect. We don’t allow conduct that targets people based on their race, gender, religion, ethnicity, nationality, disability, or sexual orientation.
Our community guidelines reflect our values: that racism and harassment have no place on Bluesky, and we will continue to take action to uphold these policies.

Over the past few months, we’ve made significant investments in Trust and Safety, and will continue to do so. This includes expanding the T&S team, improving and clarifying policies, and making moderation tools an engineering priority. Our moderation team responds to most reports within 24 hours.

On Wednesday, users reported an account that had a slur as its handle. This handle was in violation of our community guidelines, and it was our mistake that allowed it to be created. 40 minutes after it was reported, the account was taken down, and the code that allowed this to occur was patched.
To make this a great place as we grow, we’ll continue to invest in moderation, feedback, and support systems that scale with the number of users on the app.
To increase transparency and communication around trust and safety on Bluesky, we’ve created the new account @safety.bsky.app.

Meet Discover, a new custom feed we’re experimenting with! This is our latest iteration of the original What’s Hot algorithm. It mixes in a global view of what’s trending in the network with posts from accounts you follow and posts from accounts near your social graph.

We set out to build a social network that gives users more control over what they see. Our implementation of algorithmic choice lets users customize one of the most important parts of their social media experience: their feed. 

Read more about custom feeds here:

Welcome to a new paradigm in social media where you have more choice and control over one of the most important parts of your social media experience — your feed.

Learn more about how they work here:

external.title: Algorithmic Choice with Custom Feeds

text:
Some ways that custom feeds have been used so far:

• When the new season of Big Brother premiered, fans followed the live conversation with a feed.

• Artists advertise open submissions via custom feeds.

• Developers created novel algorithmic feeds to see more interesting content.

Read more about custom feeds, how they work, and what you can do with them here:

https://blueskyweb.xyz/blog/7-27-2023-custom-feeds

text:
Welcome, new users! You just helped us set a new record high for traffic on our service. 👋 

Early today, we experienced degraded performance on our server, causing the app to be slow for users, but this is now resolved.

One part of our upgraded infrastructure may affect your profile.

If you see your handle now says “Invalid handle,” please reverify it by navigating to Settings > Change my handle > Type in your current handle > Verify DNS Record > Update.

(Basically, update to the same handle.)

The above steps should resolve your handle, but if the error persists, please file a support ticket via the “Help” button in your menu so our team can assist you.

View our system status here: https://status.bsky.app/

(1/2)

(2/2)
1.46 should be available now on iOS and Web, with Android available later today or tomorrow

📢 Version 1.47 is rolling out now!

• Notifications have arrived for iOS and Android!
• On your own profile, there is now a Likes tab for seeing posts that you’ve liked.
• The composer will now suggest you “@“ someone if you’re looking at their profile.

About the Likes tab:

Likes are public on Bluesky. We’ve added a Likes tab to your own profile so you can quickly find past posts you’ve liked, but we chose not to show that tab on other users’ profiles.

Those likes can still be accessed by APIs, so other apps may show them.

text:

Key changes

1/n

Key changes (cont.)

2/n

General

Web

4/n

There are a few contributors we failed to acknowledge in the past, and we want to correct that now:

• @mozzius.dev who has helped on multiple tasks while also building their own fancy client @graysky.app

5/n
And a big 🙏❤️ to everyone for reporting issues and helping us make this app better. 6/6

It's been exactly a year since the very first post on Bluesky was created!

We just published a new blog post with some updates:

external.title: Toward Federation and an Open Network
external.description: One year ago, the first post on Bluesky was created. Now, we're working toward federation and a truly open network.

text:
Exciting news: We’re taking another step to making Bluesky an open network for public conversations.

Around the end of this month, we’ll release a public web interface. With this, you’ll be able to view posts on Bluesky without being logged in on an account.
Bluesky’s public web interface, coming in a couple weeks, will make posts much more accessible, which will be especially useful for real-time commentary and breaking news.

As a reminder, Bluesky is a public social network, so your posts, likes, etc. have always been publicly accessible through the API.

We designed Bluesky with the openness of the internet in mind. You can think of your profile as a blog on the internet.

For more on data privacy, read our user FAQ:

external.title: Bluesky User FAQ
external.description: Welcome to the Bluesky beta app! This is a user guide that answers some common questions.

text:
We previously shared that we’re releasing a public web view soon so that you can view Bluesky posts without being logged in.

The upcoming release will not have the public web view enabled yet, but it will have a tool to opt out of it.

More details in this thread 🧵

Remember, your posts, profile, and likes are all public data. But sometimes, added friction matters. This opt-out tool will only affect the logged-out view of the Bluesky app ( bsky.app ), but we recommend other apps on the open network respect the setting as well.
Soon, we’ll be sharing how users can turn on the opt-out feature, and how developers can ensure compatibility with other apps.

📢 1.57 is now rolling out!

This release includes the ability to set who can reply to your posts, and a couple of performance improvements and bug fixes. Read on for more details! 1/4

When you compose a post, you can now choose who is allowed to reply to your posts. Options include nobody, mentioned users, followed users, and members of lists you’ve created. 2/4

📢 1.57 Logged-out visibility

Next week the Bluesky app and website will enable logged-out viewing. If you dont want Bluesky to show your content, you can select this new option in the Moderation screen.

Remember Bluesky is a public network. This setting only adds friction to seeing your posts. 3/4

images.alt: A screenshot of Bluesky's side navigation. An arrow labeled "Go here" points at "Moderation"

A screenshot of the "opt out" interface

Discourage apps from showing my account to logged-out users

Bluesky will not show your profile and posts to logged-out users. Other apps may not honor this request. This does not make your account private.

Note: Bluesky is an open and public network. This setting only limits the visibility of your content on the Bluesky app and website, and other apps may not respect this setting. Your content may still be shown to logged-out users by other apps and websites.

Happy new year, Bluesky! 🦋 🎉

2023 here was packed with breaking news, thoughtful commentary, mind-blowing scientific facts, delightful art, and of course, lots of laughs.

Let's take a look back: 🧵⏪

In 2022, this app didn't exist yet. We started out with a small group of American, Brazilian, and Japanese users. If you remember when you could scroll the entire network's worth of posts in one sitting, you deserve an award! 🥇

Now, there are almost 3 million people here!

Since then, we've launched features like custom feeds, where you can select your own timeline. You no longer have to be held to the whims of black box algorithms.

Now, there are 25K+ custom feeds for sports, news, fungi, and more. We’re excited to make feeds even easier to build.

This year, we also launched our first paid service. Manage custom domains — and set them as your username on Bluesky — directly through account.bsky.app .

We're continuing to work towards a sustainable model of the future of social, where you own your relationships and experience online.

Some quick stats on the atproto ecosystem in 2023: 

• We grew from just 12 to 3 million users 
• Developers have built over 20 clients 
• There are 25K+ custom feeds, one of the first implementations of algorithmic choice

Here’s to an open social ecosystem in 2024! 🎉

There's so much more to come, and we're excited to have you along for the ride. We can't wait to welcome many more users next year, and show you even more of what we've been working on.

Thanks for being a part of the Bluesky journey. 🦋💙

text:
To mark the occasion, we teamed up with @davis.social to create a comic illustrating what Bluesky is all about. 

See if you can spot the easter eggs! 👀

[1/3]

images.alt: A multi-panel comic. Two characters stand amidst a pile of rubble. One says, 'I think it's time to leave old social. This keeps happening. I have to start over again. I'm tired.' The two characters board a boat. Jay says, 'Don't worry! Better things are ahead at Bluesky!' They arrive to a beautiful, festive area that has buildings labeled News, Discover, Art, Science, and more.

A multi-panel comic. Jay says, 'At Bluesky, you choose what you want to see instead of being held to the whims of a blackbox algorithm. There are already tens of thousands of feeds! Anyone can make or subscribe to feeds!' A troll appears. Jay says, 'And for things you don't want to see, you can stack additional layers of moderation as easily as following a new account.' Poof! Fences go up and the troll disappears. Jay continues to describe Bluesky's open network. 'With Bluesky, everything is connected. Dock at any port — you can explore the entire network. And wherever you go, your whole network comes with you.'

A multi-panel comic. One character says, 'At Bluesky, I can customize my own experience and if I move, everything comes with me?!' Jay smiles and says, 'Yes, it's the last social account you'll ever have to create!' The two run across a bridge towards a magical mountainside. They say, 'Come on, let's go explore!'

external.title: Bluesky’s Stackable Approach to Moderation - Bluesky
external.description: Today, we’re open sourcing Ozone, a tool that lets a team of moderators or curators collaboratively review reports, create labels, and inspect content on the atproto network. Later this week, we’re op...

text: We sincerely thank Jack for his help funding and initiating the bluesky project. Today, Bluesky is thriving as an open source social network running on atproto, the decentralized  protocol we have built.

With Jack’s departure, we are searching for a new board member for the Bluesky public benefit company who shares our commitment to building a social network that puts people in control of their experience. More to come!

What's next for Bluesky? We're working on some of your most requested features:

DMs, video, improved Custom Feeds, better anti-harassment features, and a new login tool called "OAuth"

Check out the roadmap here: bsky.social/about/blog/0...

As always, we’d like to thank our GitHub contributors quiple, auroursa, ivanbea, and surfdude29.

And by the way — keep an eye out for next week’s update! It’s going to be a good one. 💬

Now available: DMs! Start a private conversation with a friend directly on Bluesky within the Chat tab. 💬

Update to the latest version of the app (1.83) or refresh on desktop to start chatting!

images.alt: Screenshot of the DM interface in the Bluesky app. One message says “heyyy,” formatted in a blue bubble. The response is the monkey covering eyes emoji in a gray bubble.

text:
By default, only people you follow can message you. You can change this setting to everyone or no one, or keep it to people you follow.

Read more about how to use DMs and our planned feature updates in this blog post!

external.title: Just shipped: Bluesky Direct Messages! - Bluesky
external.description: You can now send direct messages (DMs) to people on Bluesky! Say hi to a friend, colleague, or a crush.

text:
We also squeezed in some other features and fixes in this release:

Now you can set who can reply to your posts more easily!

images.alt: Screenshot of the post composer in the Bluesky app. At the bottom, a module says “Everybody can reply.” Use this to change your reply settings.

text: We also included a bug fix: you can now remove saved feeds that are failing to load.
Also included in this release: scrolling the feed should feel snappier on Android. Thanks to GitHub user zetavg for contributing the fix! 🙏

In case you missed it, DMs are now available on Bluesky. 280k+ DMs have been sent already! 📬📈

Make sure you're on the latest version of the app (1.83) or refresh desktop to see DMs. ✨

images.alt: A screenshot of Bluesky's DM interface. The first message reads "Bluesky has direct messages now!" and the second message reads "Start chatting!"

text:
By default, only people you follow can message you. You can change this to everyone or no one in your DM settings.

Read more about how to use DMs, privacy and safety, and planned improvements in this blog post:

external.title: Just shipped: Bluesky Direct Messages! - Bluesky
external.description: You can now send direct messages (DMs) to people on Bluesky! Say hi to a friend, colleague, or a crush.

text:
Only the Bluesky moderation team can review reported DMs, and only in rare & absolutely necessary cases can moderators open DMs to investigate broader patterns of abuse. 

Access is extremely limited and tracked.

Here's a thread from @safety.bsky.app that elaborates on DM safety & privacy:

text:
📢 1.85 is rolling out now (3/6)

Account deactivation!

You can now temporarily deactivate your account. This will take down the profile and all of your content until you decide to resume — which you can do at any time.

(You can find this in your Settings page.)

images.alt:
Deactivate account
Your profile, posts, feeds, and lists will no longer be visible to other Bluesky users. You can reactivate your account at any time by logging in.

There is no time limit for account deactivation, come back any time. If you're trying to change your handle or email, do so before you deactivate.

Cancel or Yes, deactivate

text:
We’re thrilled to announce that Mike Masnick has joined Bluesky’s Board of Directors. 

He is the author of the "Protocols, Not Platforms" paper that first inspired the Bluesky initiative, and the founder and editor of Techdirt.

Mike has been an early supporter of Bluesky’s mission to create a global, open social network, as full of possibility as the early web.

Read more in our blog: 

bsky.social/about/blog/0...

external.title: Bluesky Welcomes Mike Masnick to Board of Directors - Bluesky
external.description: We’re thrilled to announce that Mike Masnick has joined Bluesky’s Board of Directors.

text:
Welcome to all of our new users, and a special welcome to the UK, which had the most Bluesky signups of any country for 5 out of the last 7 days!

What makes Bluesky different? Some key features: 🧵

Choose your own timeline.

Whether you want to see posts from your mutuals, politics, or cat photos, there's a feed for that!

bsky.app/feeds

Subscribe to stackable moderation services from people you trust.

You can layer additional filters on top of Bluesky's own moderation, like a filter for screenshots of other social networks.

bsky.app/moderation

Invite your community!

Create a starter pack today to easily onboard your friends. You can add recommended users and custom feeds.

Find starter packs in a tab on your profile.

Finally, we love hearing what you think.

Drop us a note via the Feedback button (left menu in mobile, right side on desktop). 📬

Oh hello Britain 😳

That blue line is activity in the UK spiking past all of the other countries on Bluesky right now.

Welcome, and invite a friend to join us! bsky.app/download

images.alt: A chart showing activity from various countries on Bluesky. The UK, in blue, is experiencing a huge spike.

text:
bluesky is the short king of social apps

in all seriousness, we're up against incumbents that have repeatedly lost your trust. we're young and consistently growing, and we're building an open social network that puts users first. we're very excited to have you along for the ride 🦋

images.alt: Screenshot of a graph of user counts across X, Threads, and Bluesky, found in a news article. Bluesky's column is short (but powerful!).

📢 App Version 1.90 is rolling out now (1/11)

This release is focused on personal moderation controls, and includes a lot of new tools for reducing unwanted attention!

Open this thread for more details. 👀

images.alt: Bluesky 1.90. New: list quotes on a post. New: New self-moderation tools. “Detach” quote posts. Control who can quote. Hide a reply. New: Timed mute words. Changed: Tuned the visibility of replies in Following.

text:
📢 1.90 is rolling out now (2/11)

You can now see the number of quotes on a post when you open it. If you tap on the number, you can see the quote-posts in a list.

When seeing a post in feeds or in the replies, the reposts count will now include quotes.

images.alt: A screenshot of a post showing 1 quote, and a screenshot of a listing of the quotes.

text:
📢 1.90 is rolling out now (3/11)

Every post now has the ability to “detach” quote posts.

Quote posts are great but sometimes they’re used to dunk on people. This tool gives you a quick way to remove your post from the quote, reducing the unwanted attention that a quote might bring.

images.alt: A screenshot of a quote post. The “Detach quote” menu item is highlighted. An arrow shows the post after the quote was detached, showing now “Content not available.”

text:
📢 1.90 is rolling out now (4/11)

You can now toggle whether quote posts are enabled on a post. This setting can be set in the composer, or by pressing the “Everybody can reply” link in your post after it has been published.

images.alt: A screenshot of the post composer with an arrow pointing at “Anybody can interact.” A screenshot of a post with an arrow pointing at “Everybody can reply”. A screenshot of the post interaction settings with the “Quote posts enabled” setting toggled on.

text:
📢 1.90 is rolling out now (5/11)

Thread authors now have the ability to hide replies. This only affects the thread — the reply still shows in feeds. It causes the reply to go under the “Hidden replies” section at the bottom of the thread.

images.alt: A screenshot of a reply. The “Hide reply for everyone” menu item is highlighted.

text:
📢 1.90 is rolling out now (6/11)

The Following feed now only shows conversations that involve replies between at least two people you follow. We believe this will reduce the amount of unexpected public attention gained by replies to conversations.

📢 1.90 is rolling out now (7/11)

Threads now always show their full context in the Following feed. In addition to making conversations easier to follow, this means that replying to a self-thread in order to “bump” it should now work the way people expect it to!

Screenshot: Before ➡️ After

images.alt: A before and after screenshot of a thread in the following feed, now showing the full context of the latest reply.

text:
📢 1.90 is rolling out now (8/11)

Because we changed the way that replies show in Following, we simplified the Following Feed preferences to no longer have a "Followed users only" toggle and to no longer have a "number of likes" filter.

📢 1.90 is rolling out now (9/11)

Also:

• Mute words can now be given a duration.
• Mute words can be toggled to apply only to unfollowed users.
• Some logout bugfixes.

📢 1.90 is rolling out now (10/11)

We’re publishing a series of blog posts on Trust & Safety efforts at Bluesky. The first in the series covers the features we’re releasing in this version.

Read it here: bsky.social/about/blog/0...

text:
Another day at Bluesky, and it looks like growth is not slowing down! Welcome!

We’d like to take a moment to share our stance on AI and user data:

A number of artists and creators have made their home on Bluesky, and we hear their concerns with other platforms training on their data. We do not use any of your content to train generative AI, and have no intention of doing so.

Bluesky uses AI internally to assist in content moderation, which helps us triage posts and shield human moderators from harmful content. We also use AI in the Discover algorithmic feed to serve you posts that we think you’d like.

None of these are Gen AI systems trained on user content.

Thank you for joining Bluesky, we’re happy you’re here!

Our full Terms of Service and other policy documents are linked below:

💡 Tip: You can set your website as your username on Bluesky!

This is one form of self-verification, and we especially encourage official organizations and brands to do this! Examples include @npr.org @react.dev @duolingobrasil.com.br. 

Here's our guide for how to do this:

text: Livestream starting in a few minutes 👇
Brief update on our ongoing efforts to allow users to specify consent (or not) for AI training: 🧵
We recently shared Bluesky’s stance on user data and AI training, which has not changed. Bluesky will not train generative AI on user data. bsky.app/profile/bsky...

Bluesky is an open and public social network, much like websites on the Internet itself.  Websites can specify whether they consent to outside companies crawling their data with a robots.txt file, and we’re investigating a similar practice here.

For example, this might look like a setting that allows Bluesky users to specify whether they consent to outside developers using their content in AI training datasets

Bluesky won’t be able to enforce this consent outside of our systems. It will be up to outside developers to respect these settings
We’re having ongoing conversations with engineers & lawyers and we hope to have more updates to share on this shortly!

text:
In video custom feeds, you can swipe up to enter a timeline of only video posts.

Try it yourself by clicking into this video custom feed and scrolling up. bsky.app/profile/bsky...
Independent no-code tools for building custom feeds like @graze.social and @skyfeed.app are already working on adding support for video feeds.

With custom feeds, you can customize your Bluesky experience. The ability to swipe vertically between videos is specific to video custom feeds. 

Standard custom feeds and posts that contain video don’t automatically enter you into a video timeline.
This update is rolling out on mobile now! If you don’t see the new video feed, try restarting your app once or twice to let the latest changes take effect.
